page.title: 01 BORINGDON AND NEWNHAM
page.content: This area lies to the north of Plympton.It is an area that can be divided into four distinct zones,the forests,the farmland,the residential and the industrial zone. Cann Wood to the north is managed by the Forestry Commission.Newnham Deer Park forest is privately owned.Moving south there is farmland.It is mainly put to crops or pasture.In the south are the residential areas of Woodford and Boringdon.In the south east is part of the Newnham Industrial Estate. Historically the area is based around two large estates. The lands of Boringdon were granted to Plympton Priory by King Edgar (957-975),and remained that way until the dissolution in 1534. Old Newnham was first recorded as the residence of Simon de Plympton at the end of the 13th centuary.
